verses.verse: And it came to pass in the month<WH2320> Nisan<WH5212>, in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king<WH4428>, when wine<WH3196> was before<WH6440> him<WH5375>, that I took up the wine<WH3196>, and gave<WH5414> it unto the king<WH4428>. Now I had not been beforetime sad<WH7451> in his presence<WH6440>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me<WH6440>, Why is thy countenance sad<WH7451>, seeing thou art not sick<WH2470>? this is nothing else but sorrow<WH7455> of heart<WH3820>. Then I was very<WH3966> sore<WH7235> afraid<WH3372>.

And I said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, Let the king<WH4428> live<WH2421> for ever<WH5769>: why should not my countenance<WH6440> be sad<WH3415>, when the city<WH5892>, the place<WH1004> of my fathers<WH1>' sepulchres<WH6913>, lieth waste<WH2720>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof are consumed<WH398> with fire<WH784>?
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me<WH1245>, For what dost thou make request? So I prayed<WH6419> to the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>.

And I said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, If it please<WH2895> the king<WH4428>, and if thy servant<WH5650> have found favor<WH3190> in thy sight<WH6440>, that thou wouldest send<WH7971> me unto Judah<WH3063>, unto the city<WH5892> of my fathers<WH1>' sepulchres<WH6913>, that I may build it<WH1129>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me<WH7694> (the queen also sitting<WH3427> by him<WH681>,) For how long shall thy journey<WH4109> be<WH7725>? and when wilt thou return? So it pleased<WH3190> the king<WH4428> to send<WH7971> me<WH5414>; and I set him a time<WH2165>.

Moreover I said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, If it please<WH2895> the king<WH4428>, let letters<WH107> be given<WH5414> me to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the River<WH5104>, that they may let me pass through<WH5674> till I come<WH935> unto Judah<WH3063>;

and a letter<WH107> unto Asaph<WH623> the keeper<WH8104> of the king<WH4428>'s forest<WH6508>, that he may give<WH5414> me timber<WH6086> to make beams<WH7136> for the gates<WH8179> of the castle<WH1002> which appertaineth to the house<WH1004>, and for the wall<WH2346> of the city<WH5892>, and for the house<WH1004> that I shall enter into<WH935>. And the king<WH4428> granted<WH5414> me<WH2896>, according to the good hand<WH3027> of my God upon me<WH430>.

Then I came<WH935> to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the River<WH5104>, and gave<WH5414> them the king<WH4428>'s letters<WH107>. Now the king<WH4428> had sent<WH7971> with me captains<WH8269> of the army<WH2428> and horsemen<WH6571>.

And when Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite<WH2772>, and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant<WH5650>, the Ammonite<WH5984>, heard<WH8085> of it<WH3415>, it grieved them exceedingly<WH7451>, for that there was come<WH935> a man<WH120> to seek<WH1245> the welfare<WH2896> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
So I came<WH935> to Jerusalem<WH3389>, and was there three<WH7969> days<WH3117>.

And I arose<WH6965> in the night<WH3915>, I and some<WH4592> few<WH4592> men<WH582> with me<WH5046>; neither told I any man<WH120> what my God<WH430> put<WH5414> into my heart<WH3820> to do<WH6213> for Jerusalem<WH3389>; neither was there any beast<WH929> with me<WH929>, save the beast that I rode upon<WH7392>.

And I went out<WH3318> by night<WH3915> by the valley<WH1516> gate<WH8179>, even toward<WH6440> the jackal<WH8577>'s well<WH5869>, and to the dung<WH830> gate<WH8179>, and viewed<WH7663> the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, which were broken down<WH6555>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof were consumed<WH398> with fire<WH784>.
Then I went on<WH5674> to the fountain<WH5869> gate<WH8179> and to the king<WH4428>'s pool<WH1295>: but there was no place<WH4725> for the beast<WH929> that was under me to pass<WH5674>.

Then went I up<WH5927> in the night<WH3915> by the brook<WH5158>, and viewed<WH7663> the wall<WH2346>; and I turned back<WH7725>, and entered<WH935> by the valley<WH1516> gate<WH8179>, and so returned<WH7725>.

And the rulers<WH5461> knew<WH3045> not whither I went<WH1980>, or what I did<WH6213>; neither had I as yet<WH3651> told<WH5046> it to the Jews<WH3064>, nor to the priests<WH3548>, nor to the nobles<WH2715>, nor to the rulers<WH5461>, nor to the rest<WH3499> that did<WH6213> the work<WH4399>.

Then said<WH559> I unto them<WH7200>, Ye see the evil<WH7451> case that we are in<WH3389>, how Jerusalem lieth waste<WH2720>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof are burned<WH3341> with fire<WH784>: come<WH3212>, and let us build up<WH1129> the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that we be no more a reproach<WH2781>.

And I told<WH5046> them of the hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> which was good<WH2896> upon me<WH4428>, as also of the king's words<WH1697> that he had spoken<WH559> unto me<WH559>. And they said, Let us rise up<WH6965> and build<WH1129>. So they strengthened<WH2388> their hands<WH3027> for the good work<WH2896>.

But when Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite<WH2772>, and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant<WH5650>, the Ammonite<WH5984>, and Geshem<WH1654> the Arabian<WH6163>, heard<WH8085> it<WH3932>, they laughed us to scorn, and despised<WH959> us<WH559>, and said, What is this thing<WH1697> that ye do<WH6213>? will ye rebel<WH4775> against the king<WH4428>?

Then answered<WH7725> I them<WH559>, and said unto them<WH430>, The God of heaven<WH8064>, he will prosper<WH6743> us<WH5650>; therefore we his servants will arise<WH6965> and build<WH1129>: but ye have no portion<WH2506>, nor right<WH6666>, nor memorial<WH2146>, in Jerusalem<WH3389>.
